thread.title: Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS'
thread.title_full: Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS'

author: MARCELA ISAZA
title: Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS'
text:
Chris Pizzello Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS' 
Lady Gaga, left, and executive producer/director/writer Ryan Murphy arrive at the Los Angeles premiere screening of "American Horror Story: Hotel" at Regal Cinemas L.A. Live on Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP) Chris Pizzello Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS' 
Lady Gaga, left, and Taylor Kinney arrive at the Los Angeles premiere screening of "American Horror Story: Hotel" at Regal Cinemas L.A. Live on Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP) John Salangsang Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS' 
Angela Bassett attends the LA Premiere Screening of "American Horror Story: Hotel" held at Regal Cinemas L.A. Live on Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015, in Los Angeles. (Photo by John Salangsang/Invision/AP) Chris Pizzello Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS' 
Sarah Paulson arrives at the Los Angeles premiere screening of "American Horror Story: Hotel" at Regal Cinemas L.A. Live on Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP) John Salangsang Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS' 
Kathy Bates attends the LA Premiere Screening of "American Horror Story: Hotel" held at Regal Cinemas L.A. Live on Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015, in Los Angeles. (Photo by John Salangsang/Invision/AP) Chris Pizzello Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS' 
Angela Bassett arrives at the Los Angeles premiere screening of "American Horror Story: Hotel" at Regal Cinemas L.A. Live on Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP) Chris Pizzello Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS' 
Naomi Campbell, left, and Cuba Gooding, Jr. arrive at the Los Angeles premiere screening of "American Horror Story: Hotel" at Regal Cinemas L.A. Live on Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP) Chris Pizzello Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS' 
Naomi Campbell, left, and Denis O'Hare arrive at the Los Angeles premiere screening of "American Horror Story: Hotel" at Regal Cinemas L.A. Live on Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP) Chris Pizzello Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS' 
Lady Gaga, right, kisses executive producer/director/writer Ryan Murphy as they arrive at the Los Angeles premiere screening of "American Horror Story: Hotel" at Regal Cinemas L.A. Live on Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP) John Salangsang Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS' 
Lady Gaga, left, and Taylor Kinney attend the LA Premiere Screening of "American Horror Story: Hotel" held at Regal Cinemas L.A. Live on Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015, in Los Angeles. (Photo by John Salangsang/Invision/AP) Lady Gaga said she felt alive and 'like herself' on 'AHS' Associated Press | 
LOS ANGELES (AP) — Appearing in the new season of "American Horror Story" was a life boost for Lady Gaga. 
The singer raved about her experience on "American Horror Story: Hotel" as she arrived for the star-studded premiere of the FX show on Saturday night.
